channel.title: AVbin
channel.description:
AVbin is a thin cross-platform wrapper around Libav’s video and audio decoding functionality, providing binary compatibility for applications and languages that need it.

AVbin was originally created for the Pyglet project as its media decoding/decompression library, though others may find AVbin useful as well.

item.title: AVbin 9 Released (Unstable)
item.description:
I announce AVbin 9 today with mixed feelings. It marks a lot of good work in build scripts and switching to Libav. On the other hand, since I wanted to minimize C code changes for this release, the branch of Libav (0.6) that we used ends up being _older_ code than we used in the 8.1 release -- with some regressions in quality/performance.

End users are encouraged to use the 8.1 release for now.

Developers are encouraged to test version 9 out and give us feedback.

API Changes:

- DEPRECATED avbin_get_ffmpeg_revision()
- ADDED avbin_get_libav_commit()
- ADDED avbin_get_libav_version()

item.title: AVbin 8.1 Released
item.description: AVbin 8.1 is officially released today. This was primarily a build-process fix release. The most notable changes are that the 32-bit OS X and 64-bit Linux versions should actually work. Version 8 of the former was actually 64-bit, version 8 of the latter didn’t link correctly.

item.title: New Logo & Online Documentation
item.description: Today I set out to generate online documentation, got distracted and made a logo instead, and then found that I still had time to generate the documentation. It was a very productive day.

item.title: AVbin 8
item.description:
I am proud to announce AVbin 8, the first full release since 2008.

To all those who pointed me in the right direction on mailing lists and forums: Thank you!!! I would like to specifically mention Alex Holkner, who created this project in the first place, and Micah Richert, whose shoulders I stood on for this release.

AVbin 8 Highlights
- Established which platforms were going to be supported going forward (added Win64 and OS X 64-bit Intel; dropped OS X 32-bit PPC)
- Created development/build environments for each platform
- Successfully compiled/released a build for each platform
- Migrated from svn on Google Project to git on Github
- Created a new project web site
- 28 commits
- Approximately 15 issues closed...though mostly since they just don’t apply any more.

Known Issues with AVbin 8:
- The version of FFmpeg used is one year old, and has known bugs and security problems
- The AVbin binaries have not been tested internally.
- The AVbin binaries have not been tested with Pyglet.
- It is known that the build doesn’t actually work for a lot of file formats you would expect it to on at least one platform (win32)

The previous release was based on a 3-year old FFmpeg revision. That revision had even more bugs and security problems than the newer one we used. When I took over as the new maintainer almost exactly a month ago, I accepted the generous offer of Micah Richert to use his personal build he had put together a year ago as a starting point. Since using the newest code was not a goal for this release, I simply used the exact revision that Micah used, to minimize the already considerable effort it was taking to get this project resurrected.

I’ve put together a Roadmap for things to accomplish for AVbin 9. Check it out!

~ Nathan

item.title: AVbin project migrated to Github
item.description: Welcome to the new AVbin site! AVbin has moved from subversion on Google code to Git on Github. We hope that the move promotes more collaboration and participation in the project.
